marketNews.title: Hal lain yang lagi hot yang perlu kamu ketahui...
marketNews.content: Antara reports that the OJK ensures its readiness to approve gradually if there are proposals related to the increase in the minimum free float up to 30 percent. Currently, the OJK is considering raising the minimum free float rule from 7.5% to 10% for companies listed on the Indonesian stock exchange. The Director of Company Valuation at IDX, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, stated that IDX is conducting a study related to the free float regulation, while still considering the condition from the listed companies' side and investor capacity. Previously, the Chairman of DPR Commission XI, Mukhamad Misbakhun, proposed that the minimum free float in the Indonesian capital market could rise to the range of 30%, reflecting similar regulations in stock exchanges in Southeast Asian countries.Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated on Monday (6/10) that a new Presidential Regulation (Perpres) regarding the waste-to-energy program which revises Perpres No. 35/2018 will be issued this week. Eniya added that the Perpres will mandate local governments to provide land and waste levies or fees paid by the public for waste logistics, and require feedstock or raw material for the waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) to be available for 30 years.Goldman Sachs on Monday (6/10) raised its gold price projection for December 2026 from 4,300 US dollars per troy ounce to 4,900 US dollars per troy ounce. This projection upgrade is based on strong projected gold purchases by central banks - where Goldman Sachs estimates average purchases by central banks will reach 80 tons in 2025 and 70 tons in 2026 - and increasing demand for gold-backed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) along with the projected 100 bps Fed interest rate cuts in mid-2026.The Malaysian Palm Oil Association estimates that Malaysian palm oil production decreased by -2.4% MoM in September 2025 to reach 1.81 million tons, which is more moderate than the Bloomberg consensus survey last week which projected a -4.3% MoM decrease. Head of Trading and Hedging Strategies at Kaleesuwari Intercontinental, Gnanasekar Thiagarajan, mentioned that the production decline in Malaysia could support palm oil prices amid potential demand decline from India following the end of the festive season and the onset of winter. Palm oil tends to thicken in cold weather, pushing buyers to switch to other options like soybean oil. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources officially issued Ministerial Regulation No. 17/2025 which cuts the validity period of the work plan and budget (RKAB) from 3 years to 1 year. This step is aimed at giving the government greater control over production rates and supporting commodity prices. This change will take effect soon, according to a statement from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources on Tuesday (7/10). The production quota for 2025 remains valid, but mining companies need to reapply for quotas previously issued for 2026 and 2027.Bank Indonesia noted that adjusted primary money (M0) grew by +18.6% YoY in September 2025 to reach 2,152.4 trillion rupiah (vs. August 2025: +7.3% YoY), influenced by a +37% YoY growth in general bank deposits at Bank Indonesia adjusted and a +13.5% YoY growth in currency in circulation. Bank Indonesia explained that this adjusted M0 growth has taken into account the impact of liquidity incentives provided.Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2025 fell to the level of 148.7 billion US dollars (vs. August 2025: 150.7 billion US dollars), marking a decline for 3 consecutive months as well as the lowest level in the last 14 months. This result was influenced by the policy of stabilizing the rupiah exchange rate and the government's foreign debt payments. The position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.2 months of imports or 6 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of about 3 months of imports.

marketNews.title: Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources stated a new Presidential Regulation on waste-to-energy will be issued this week.
marketNews.content: Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated on Monday (6/10) that a new Presidential Regulation (Perpres) regarding the waste-to-energy program which revises Perpres No. 35/2018 will be issued this week. Eniya added that the Perpres will mandate local governments to provide land and waste levies or fees paid by the public for waste logistics, and require feedstock or raw material for the waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) to be available for 30 years.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources cuts mining quota validity period to one year.
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources officially issued Ministerial Regulation No. 17/2025 which cuts the validity period of the work plan and budget (RKAB) from 3 years to 1 year. This step is aimed at giving the government greater control over production rates and supporting commodity prices. This change will take effect soon, according to a statement from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources on Tuesday (7/10). The production quota for 2025 remains valid, but mining companies need to reapply for quotas previously issued for 2026 and 2027.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia noted adjusted primary money grew by +18.6% YoY in September 2025.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that adjusted primary money (M0) adjusted on September 2025 grew +18.6% YoY to reach 2,152.4 trillion rupiah (vs. August 2025: +7.3% YoY), influenced by a +37% YoY growth in general bank deposits at Bank Indonesia adjusted and a +13.5% YoY growth in currency in circulation. Bank Indonesia explained that this adjusted M0 growth has taken into account the impact of liquidity incentives provided.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves fell to 148.7 billion USD at the end of September 2025.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2025 fell to the level of 148.7 billion US dollars (vs. August 2025: 150.7 billion US dollars), marking a decline for 3 consecutive months as well as the lowest level in the last 14 months. This result was influenced by the policy of stabilizing the rupiah exchange rate and the government's foreign debt payments. The position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.2 months of imports or 6 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of about 3 months of imports.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) plans US$1.85 Billion Private Placement from Danantara
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) plans to hold a private placement through the issuance of approximately 407.9 billion new shares to PT Danantara Asset Management at an execution price of 75 rupiah per share, resulting in a total transaction value of approximately 1.85 billion US dollars or approximately 30.5 trillion rupiah. This transaction plan includes: 1) cash capital injection up to 1.44 billion US dollars; and 2) conversion of shareholder loan amounting to 405 million US dollars. This private placement will cause the public ownership portion to be diluted from 27.46% to approximately 5.03%, while Danantara's ownership portion will increase from 64.54% to approximately 93.5%.The shareholder loan from Danantara itself was provided in June 2025 and has been fully disbursed by GIAA as of September 18, 2025. Meanwhile, the capital increase plan was previously disclosed in July 2025 along with the announcement of GIAA's 2Q25 financial statement audit plan. In total value, this private placement plan is higher than initial reports, which mentioned that the total financing support design from Danantara only reached 1 billion US dollars.The proceeds from the private placement are planned to be used as follows: 29%: working capital and company operations. 37%: capital increase in Citilink to finance working capital and operations, which may be allocated to support Citilink's fleet operations. 22%: fleet expansion for the company and Citilink, where the company once revealed plans to add more than 100 aircraft until 2029. 12%: capital increase in Citilink for the payment of aircraft fuel purchases from Pertamina.This private placement plan will be discussed in the EGM on November 12, 2025.Key TakeawayBased on the company's (proforma) impact analysis, this corporate action will have a positive impact on the company's financial health compared to before the transaction (as of June 30, 2025) as follows: Positive Equity - GIAA's total equity will increase to a positive approximately 350 million US dollars from a negative position of approximately 1.5 billion US dollars. This positive equity may imply GIAA shares being removed from the special monitoring board (FCA). Liquidity and Solvency Improvement - The company's cash and cash equivalents will increase by approximately 1.44 billion US dollars, causing the Current Ratio to increase from 0.44x to 1.53x. Meanwhile, the liabilities to assets ratio will decrease from 123% to 96%.

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Shareholders Reportedly Will Sell Minority Shares to FrieslandCampina
tickerNews.content: DealStreetAsia reports that shareholders of Ultra Jaya Milk Industry & Trading Company have started discussions with the Dutch dairy cooperative, FrieslandCampina, regarding the sale of minority shares and a strategic partnership. DealStreetAsia mentioned that these discussions are still in the exploration stage and are not yet binding. Besides the transaction of ULTJ minority shares, these discussions also cover a long-term goal for full consolidation, according to DealStreetAsia. Both FrieslandCampina and its entity in Indonesia, Frisian Flag Indonesia, declined to comment on this issue, while ULTJ has not provided confirmation regarding this news to DealStreetAsia.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Daya Investasi ($CDIA) to add 4.7 MWp solar power capacity in November 2025
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi through its subsidiary, PT Krakatau Chandra Energi, announced that an additional solar power plant (PLTS) capacity of 4.7 MWp will start operating in November 2025 in Cilegon, Banten. This addition will bring the total installed capacity up to 11 MWp. CDIA explained that the company will continue to expand PLTS capacity gradually as part of its long-term strategy in supporting the transition towards renewable energy.

tickerNews.title: Timah ($TINS) President Director Agrees to 4 Miner Demands Following Protests
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Timah, Restu Widiyantoro, stated on Monday (6/10) that the company agreed to 4 demands from the miners, including a tin price of 300 thousand rupiah for SN 70%, allowing miners to mine in TINS' IUP areas provided the output is sold to TINS, and the disbandment of the tin task force. Media Indonesia reported that Restu's statement came after miners in Bangka Belitung Province held a demonstration against TINS. Meanwhile, Tempo reported that the demonstration by these miners was triggered by their anxiety regarding the activities of the task force formed by TINS and the government in cracking down on illegal tin mining.

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Gold Resources ($EMAS) Increases Gold Ore Reserves at Pani Mine by +150%
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Gold Resources announced an increase in gold ore reserves for the Pani gold mine in Gorontalo from 1.9 million troy ounces to 4.8 million troy ounces or an increase of approximately +150%, according to a Bisnis report. The Pani gold mine itself commenced mining operations on October 1, 2025, with the target for the first gold production in 1Q26.

tickerNews.title: Sentul City ($BKSL) expects Deed of Sale for 152 Hectares Land Worth Rp2.05 Trillion to be Signed by End of 2025
tickerNews.content: Sentul City stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company expects the deed of sale for 152 hectares of land worth 2.05 trillion rupiah to PT Genting Properti Abadi to be signed by the end of 2025. Previously, in July 2024, Genting announced plans to purchase this land from BKSL's subsidiary, PT Aftanesia Raya, as well as a third party named PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa. PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa is not a subsidiary of BKSL. In a clarification in July 2024, BKSL announced that the book value of the total 152 hectares of land to be acquired by Genting was 11.4 billion rupiah as of 1Q24. Nevertheless, neither Genting nor BKSL detailed the breakdown of the transaction value received by PT Aftanesia Raya and PT Primatama Cahaya Sentosa.

tickerNews.title: Krakatau Steel ($KRAS) Settles Accelerated Obligation with Private Banks, Obtaining Principal Waiver of Approximately 80%
tickerNews.content: Krakatau Steel announced that the company obtained written approval from 4 private banks to settle accelerated obligations with waivers on restructuring debt. The total debt settled amounted to 248.2 billion rupiah and 159.1 million US dollars, while KRAS only paid 49.6 billion rupiah and 31.8 million US dollars, resulting in the company obtaining a principal waiver of approximately 80%. The company also received a waiver of interest and penalties totaling 112.9 billion rupiah and 18.8 million US dollars. This agreement will reduce debt by 174.3 million US dollars from the total restructured debt of 1.4 billion US dollars. This restructuring will reduce interest burden and ease pressure on cash flow.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN) Affiliate Sells ~481.2 Million Shares to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: A shareholder of Barito Renewables Energy affiliated with the controller, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 481.2 million BREN shares on October 2, 2025, at an average price of 8,650 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.2 trillion rupiah and was aimed at increasing the free float of shares outstanding in the market. After this transaction, Green Era Energy's ownership decreased from approximately 23.35% to approximately 22.99%.

tickerNews.title: Astra Graphia ($ASGR) Plans to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Book Year
tickerNews.content: Astra Graphia plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to approximately 40.5 billion rupiah or 30 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 2.5% as of Tuesday (7/10). The cum dividend on the regular and negotiation markets is on October 15, 2025, while payment is on October 24, 2025.
